授業目的: To continue to develop the listening and speaking skills learned in the Spring semester to more effectively participate in interactions relevant to the lives of university students in Japan. This includes discussing day-to-day activities in English as well as completing paired or group presentations and small-group discussions.
到達目標:
By the end of the course, learners will be better able to:

 

*speak more fluently on selected topics and tasks through regular small and large scale presentations;

*use a range of interaction strategies and relevant language to communicate effectively in group work and discussions;

*exchange opinions on a range of issues; 

*present ideas using a coherent structure, appropriate connecting language, and paralinguistic skills (e.g. eye contact, posture/gestures) for individual presentations;

*use visual aids (e.g. poster/ppt) to effectively support presentation content;

*understand English spoken in a range of accents from around the world;

* understand and use topic-specific and general, mid-frequency vocabulary items.

*read fluently, through regular extensive-reading practice.
特記事項: 【合併】英語Iｄ　３（経済学部）/英語IIｂ　３（経済学部）
授業方法: Classes will be interactive and group-work based, with some language and skills guidance from the teacher. Learners are expected to participate actively in all tasks to gain the maximum benefit to their spoken English skills. There will be a range of spoken tasks, including group discussions, presentations, supported by reading & listening tasks. Materials will include a selection from the textbook as well as additional materials distributed in class and on LUNA.

第1回: Spring semester review & Fall course preview;  Summer vacation discussion; diagnostic vocabulary test
第5回: Unit 7: Story telling; discussion skills review
第8回: Speaking test reflection and session 9 preparation
第9回: Unit 9: Discussing culture; presentation skills review
第10回: Unit 9: Discussing culture; presentation skills 2, group presentations
第11回: Unit 10: Music; presentation skills - presenting in pairs
